contentrichtext.text: '''Álfhildr''' was the name of several women in [[Norse mythology]] and legend. *A princess of [[Álfheim]]. *[[Alf and Alfhild]] *[[Auðr the Deep-Minded|Alfhild/Auðr]] (Old Norse: Auðr in djúpúðga) was a Norse princess, the daughter of [[Ivar Vidfamne]], and the mother of [[Harald Wartooth]], who appears in Sögubrot, Hversu Noregr byggdist and in the Lay of Hyndla. She would have lived during the 7th or 8th century. *[[Alfhild, concubine of Olaf II of Norway]] English concubine Alfhild of King [[Olaf II of Norway|Olaf Haraldsson]], mother of [[Magnus the Good]]. *[[Álfhildr (Gautreks saga)]], the daughter of king Harald of [[Lüchow-Dannenberg|Wendland]]. She married [[Gautrekr]]. {{Norse mythology}} {{disambig}} [[Category:People in Norse mythology and legends]]
